title: Springfield-Style Cashew Chicken
ingredients: 4  skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
4 tablespoons cold water, or as needed
method: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Heat oil in a large skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil.

Step 2: While the oil is heating, whisk flour, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and baking soda together in a shallow bowl. Whisk eggs in a second shallow bowl. Dip chicken pieces into flour mixture, then eggs, then into flour mixture again.
Step 3: Working in batches as necessary, deep-fry coated chicken in hot oil for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
Step 4: While deep-frying the chicken, bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Place cashew nuts and green onions onto the prepared baking sheet.

Step 5: Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, sugar, and white pepper to boiling broth. Mix remaining 4 tablespoons cornstarch with cold water in a cup to make a slurry. Slowly stir slurry into hot broth mixture to thicken, then cook for another 5 minutes over medium-low heat.
Step 6: Meanwhile, heat cashew nuts and green onions in the preheated oven for about 5 minutes.
Step 7: Pour sauce over fried chicken and top with cashews and green onions.
